text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: SCENE IV. The forest.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Enter DUKE SENIOR, AMIENS, JAQUES, ORLANDO, OLIVER, and CELIA

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Dost thou believe, Orlando, that the boy

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Can do all this that he hath promised?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: I sometimes do believe, and sometimes do not;

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: As those that fear they hope, and know they fear.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Enter ROSALIND, SILVIUS, and PHEBE

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Patience once more, whiles our compact is urged:

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You say, if I bring in your Rosalind,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You will bestow her on Orlando here?

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: That would I, had I kingdoms to give with her.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: And you say, you will have her, when I bring her?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: That would I, were I of all kingdoms king.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You say, you'll marry me, if I be willing?

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: That will I, should I die the hour after.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: But if you do refuse to marry me,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You'll give yourself to this most faithful shepherd?

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: So is the bargain.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You say, that you'll have Phebe, if she will?

speaker: SILVIUS
text_entry: Though to have her and death were both one thing.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: I have promised to make all this matter even.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Keep you your word, O duke, to give your daughter;

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: You yours, Orlando, to receive his daughter:

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Keep your word, Phebe, that you'll marry me,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Or else refusing me, to wed this shepherd:

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Keep your word, Silvius, that you'll marry her.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: If she refuse me: and from hence I go,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: To make these doubts all even.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Exeunt ROSALIND and CELIA

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: I do remember in this shepherd boy

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Some lively touches of my daughter's favour.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: My lord, the first time that I ever saw him

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Methought he was a brother to your daughter:

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: But, my good lord, this boy is forest-born,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: And hath been tutor'd in the rudiments

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Of many desperate studies by his uncle,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Whom he reports to be a great magician,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Obscured in the circle of this forest.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: There is, sure, another flood toward, and these

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: couples are coming to the ark. Here comes a pair of

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: very strange beasts, which in all tongues are called fools.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Salutation and greeting to you all!

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Good my lord, bid him welcome: this is the

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: motley-minded gentleman that I have so often met in

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: the forest: he hath been a courtier, he swears.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: If any man doubt that, let him put me to my

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: purgation. I have trod a measure; I have flattered

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: a lady; I have been politic with my friend, smooth

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: with mine enemy; I have undone three tailors; I have

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: had four quarrels, and like to have fought one.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: And how was that ta'en up?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Faith, we met, and found the quarrel was upon the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: seventh cause.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: How seventh cause? Good my lord, like this fellow.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: I like him very well.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: God 'ild you, sir; I desire you of the like. I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: press in here, sir, amongst the rest of the country

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: copulatives, to swear and to forswear: according as

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: marriage binds and blood breaks: a poor virgin,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: sir, an ill-favoured thing, sir, but mine own; a poor

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: humour of mine, sir, to take that that no man else

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: will: rich honesty dwells like a miser, sir, in a

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: poor house; as your pearl in your foul oyster.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: By my faith, he is very swift and sententious.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: According to the fool's bolt, sir, and such dulcet diseases.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: But, for the seventh cause; how did you find the

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: quarrel on the seventh cause?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Upon a lie seven times removed:--bear your body more

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: seeming, Audrey:--as thus, sir. I did dislike the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: cut of a certain courtier's beard: he sent me word,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: if I said his beard was not cut well, he was in the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: mind it was: this is called the Retort Courteous.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: If I sent him word again 'it was not well cut,' he

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: would send me word, he cut it to please himself:

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: this is called the Quip Modest. If again 'it was

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: not well cut,' he disabled my judgment: this is

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: called the Reply Churlish. If again 'it was not

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: well cut,' he would answer, I spake not true: this

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: is called the Reproof Valiant. If again 'it was not

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: well cut,' he would say I lied: this is called the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Counter-cheque Quarrelsome: and so to the Lie

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Circumstantial and the Lie Direct.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: And how oft did you say his beard was not well cut?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: I durst go no further than the Lie Circumstantial,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: nor he durst not give me the Lie Direct; and so we

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: measured swords and parted.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Can you nominate in order now the degrees of the lie?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: O sir, we quarrel in print, by the book; as you have

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: books for good manners: I will name you the degrees.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: The first, the Retort Courteous; the second, the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Quip Modest; the third, the Reply Churlish; the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: fourth, the Reproof Valiant; the fifth, the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Countercheque Quarrelsome; the sixth, the Lie with

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: Circumstance; the seventh, the Lie Direct. All

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: these you may avoid but the Lie Direct; and you may

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: avoid that too, with an If. I knew when seven

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: justices could not take up a quarrel, but when the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: parties were met themselves, one of them thought but

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: of an If, as, 'If you said so, then I said so;' and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: they shook hands and swore brothers. Your If is the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text_entry: only peacemaker; much virtue in If.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Is not this a rare fellow, my lord? he's as good at

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: any thing and yet a fool.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: He uses his folly like a stalking-horse and under

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: the presentation of that he shoots his wit.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Enter HYMEN, ROSALIND, and CELIA

text_entry: Still Music

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Then is there mirth in heaven,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: When earthly things made even

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Atone together.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Good duke, receive thy daughter

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Hymen from heaven brought her,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Yea, brought her hither,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: That thou mightst join her hand with his

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Whose heart within his bosom is.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: [To DUKE SENIOR]  To you I give myself, for I am yours.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: To ORLANDO

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: To you I give myself, for I am yours.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: If there be truth in sight, you are my daughter.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: If there be truth in sight, you are my Rosalind.

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: If sight and shape be true,

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: Why then, my love adieu!

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: I'll have no father, if you be not he:

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: I'll have no husband, if you be not he:

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Nor ne'er wed woman, if you be not she.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Peace, ho! I bar confusion:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: 'Tis I must make conclusion

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Of these most strange events:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Here's eight that must take hands

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: To join in Hymen's bands,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: If truth holds true contents.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: You and you no cross shall part:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: You and you are heart in heart

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: You to his love must accord,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Or have a woman to your lord:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: You and you are sure together,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: As the winter to foul weather.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Whiles a wedlock-hymn we sing,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Feed yourselves with questioning;

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: That reason wonder may diminish,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: How thus we met, and these things finish.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: SONG.

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Wedding is great Juno's crown:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: O blessed bond of board and bed!

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: 'Tis Hymen peoples every town;

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: High wedlock then be honoured:

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: Honour, high honour and renown,

speaker: HYMEN
text_entry: To Hymen, god of every town!

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: O my dear niece, welcome thou art to me!

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Even daughter, welcome, in no less degree.

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: I will not eat my word, now thou art mine;

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: Thy faith my fancy to thee doth combine.

speaker: PHEBE
text_entry: Enter JAQUES DE BOYS

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Let me have audience for a word or two:

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: I am the second son of old Sir Rowland,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: That bring these tidings to this fair assembly.

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Duke Frederick, hearing how that every day

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Men of great worth resorted to this forest,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Address'd a mighty power; which were on foot,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: In his own conduct, purposely to take

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: His brother here and put him to the sword:

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: And to the skirts of this wild wood he came;

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Where meeting with an old religious man,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: After some question with him, was converted

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: Both from his enterprise and from the world,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: His crown bequeathing to his banish'd brother,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: And all their lands restored to them again

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: That were with him exiled. This to be true,

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: I do engage my life.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Welcome, young man;

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Thou offer'st fairly to thy brothers' wedding:

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: To one his lands withheld, and to the other

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: A land itself at large, a potent dukedom.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: First, in this forest, let us do those ends

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: That here were well begun and well begot:

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: And after, every of this happy number

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: That have endured shrewd days and nights with us

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Shall share the good of our returned fortune,

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: According to the measure of their states.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Meantime, forget this new-fall'n dignity

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: And fall into our rustic revelry.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Play, music! And you, brides and bridegrooms all,

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: With measure heap'd in joy, to the measures fall.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Sir, by your patience. If I heard you rightly,

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: The duke hath put on a religious life

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: And thrown into neglect the pompous court?

speaker: JAQUES DE BOYS
text_entry: He hath.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: To him will I : out of these convertites

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: There is much matter to be heard and learn'd.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: You to your former honour I bequeath;

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Your patience and your virtue well deserves it:

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: You to a love that your true faith doth merit:

speaker: JAQUES

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: You to your land and love and great allies:

speaker: JAQUES

speaker: JAQUES

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: Is but for two months victuall'd. So, to your pleasures:

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: I am for other than for dancing measures.

speaker: DUKE SENIOR
text_entry: Stay, Jaques, stay.

speaker: JAQUES
text_entry: To see no pastime I what you would have

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: It is not the fashion to see the lady the epilogue;

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: but it is no more unhandsome than to see the lord

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: the prologue. If it be true that good wine needs

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: no bush, 'tis true that a good play needs no

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: epilogue; yet to good wine they do use good bushes,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: and good plays prove the better by the help of good

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: epilogues. What a case am I in then, that am

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: neither a good epilogue nor cannot insinuate with

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: you in the behalf of a good play! I am not

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: furnished like a beggar, therefore to beg will not

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: become me: my way is to conjure you; and I'll begin

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: with the women. I charge you, O women, for the love

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: you bear to men, to like as much of this play as

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: please you: and I charge you, O men, for the love

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: you bear to women--as I perceive by your simpering,

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: none of you hates them--that between you and the

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: women the play may please. If I were a woman I

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: would kiss as many of you as had beards that pleased

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: me, complexions that liked me and breaths that I

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: defied not: and, I am sure, as many as have good

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: beards or good faces or sweet breaths will, for my

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: kind offer, when I make curtsy, bid me farewell.
